ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class taught me some tools to import, handle, and analyze spatial data. Additionally, we reviewed a host of methods -- some unique to spatial data, and some extensions of other forms of data analysis that incorporate features to analyze spatial data. It was incredibly helpful to learn in the context of R language.
This course surveys a variety of techniques and tests for analysis of data across space. Krigging, Spatial autocorrelation, geographically weighted regression.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths - cover lots of different methods, final project gives space to deeply engage with spatial data and various techniques to analyze; Henry, the TA, is one of the greatest strengths of this class -- his dedication, lectures on the practical applications and tools to analyze spatial data were invaluable. He also made time to discuss outside the class, which is key when encountering problems when handling spatial data. Weakness - lots of different techniques to interpret and digest by the end of the semester
The material is too much to apprehend in a semester

The course is a bit disorganized there isnt a lot of definitive work in spatial statistics because it is a more recent field. The information is valuable if you have spatial data to work with and complements the understanding of stats developed in most other courses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you are at all interested in learning how to build maps and handle spatial data, I would highly recommend this class. It would be helpful to have some experience in regression before this class.
If you have a dataset youre interested in or want to do public health or environmental work, then this course would be very useful.
